idlastro/

delvarx.pro


NAME: DELVARX PURPOSE: Delete up to 10 variables for memory management (can call from routines) EXPLANATION: Like intrinsic DELVAR function, but can be used from any calling level

Modified in January 2012 to always free memory associated with pointers/objects and remove the use EXECUTE() Also look at CALLING SEQUENCE: DELVARX, p0, [p1, p2......p9]

INPUTS: p0, p1...p9 - variables to delete

OBSOLETE KEYWORD: /FREE_MEM - formerly freed memory associated with pointers and objects. Since this is now the DELVARX default this keyword does nothing.

METHOD: Uses HEAP_FREE and PTR_NEW(/NO_COPY) to delete variables and free memory

REVISION HISTORY: Copied from the Solar library, written by slf, 25-Feb-1993 Added to Astronomy Library, September 1995 Modified, 26-Mar-2003, Zarro (EER/GSFC) 26-Mar-2003 - added FREE_MEM to free pointer/objects Modified, 28-Jan-2012, E. Rykoff (SLAC), W. Landsman - replace EXECUTE calls with SCOPE_VARFETCH.

top source delvarx

delvarx, p0, p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, p6, p7, p8, p9, free_mem=free_mem
